level.heading: REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF APPLICATION FOR CERTIFICATE OF INCLUSIONARY ZONINGOMPLIANCE (§ 14-2203) If the Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs determines that anpplication for a Certificate of Inclusionary Zoning Compliance does notemonstrate compliance with the Inclusionary Zoning Program or the informationrovided is insufficient, the Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairshall provide to the Inclusionary Development Owner a written notice of theeficiency and shall allow the Inclusionary Development Owner a reasonableeriod of time, designated in the written notice, to cure the deficiency. If the Inclusionary Development Owner fails to cure the deficiency within theeriod of time set forth in the written notice, the Department of Consumer andegulatory Affairs may deny the application. If the application for a Certificate of Inclusionary Zoning Complianceemonstrates compliance with the Inclusionary Zoning Program, and the proposednclusionary Development Covenant conforms to the requirements of § 2204, theepartment of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs shall review and issue theertificate of Inclusionary Zoning Compliance and the Department of Housing andommunity Development shall review and issue the Inclusionary Developmentovenant prior to final approval of the building permit application. The building permit application may be approved only after both the Certificatef Inclusionary Zoning Compliance and the Inclusionary Development Covenant areiled among land records.
